definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: She’s always grousing about the work-load.
Serving multiple appetizers and finger foods cuts down on your work.
sentences.chinese: 提供多种开胃菜和能减少你工作量的手抓食物。

sentences.english: The robot described itself as an extension of a person to help humans increase the workload.
sentences.chinese: 机械手把它本身说成是人的延长帮助人类增加工作量。

sentences.english: Thus, operations of solving the equation and inner storage capacity are greatly reduced.
sentences.chinese: 从而使解方程的计算工作量和内贮容量大为减少。

sentences.english: This strategy makes the emphasis of reengineering put on the reengineering of procedure rule sets which can be used to reflect the beh…
sentences.chinese: 这种策略减少了经营过程重组的周期和工作量。

sentences.english: For testing purposes an multi-core development machine can be sufficient for reasonably small workloads.
sentences.chinese: 如果用于测试，那么多核开发机足以胜任小的工作量。

sentences.english: The new machine lightens our workload a great deal.
sentences.chinese: 这台新机器大大减轻了我们的工作量。

sentences.english: In South Carolina, it was a massive get-out-the-vote effort.
sentences.chinese: 在南卡罗莱纳，是工作量很大的计票工作。

sentences.english: This bulk 25-pack of Straw 'C' is ideal for those with larger caseloads.
sentences.chinese: 大包装的吸管适用于工作量多的治疗师。

sentences.english: Each configuration performed the same amount of work at each load level.
sentences.chinese: 每种配置在各自的负载级别执行相同的工作量。

sentences.english: All servers go through some sort of cycle in their workload activity.
sentences.chinese: 所有服务器在其工作量活动中都会经历几种周期。

sentences.english: It is worth restating, though, that other workloads may have different overheads.
sentences.chinese: 可是需要重申的是其它工作量可能有不同的开销。

sentences.english: Simplify the numerical calculation and reduce the procedures section, reduce programming work.
sentences.chinese: 简化数值计算和减少程序段，降低编程工作量。

sentences.english: You can highlight this by investigating the nature of the workload.
sentences.chinese: 可以通过调查工作量的性质来突出这一点。

sentences.english: Workload is very arduous, end up with nothing definite later.
sentences.chinese: 工作量是非常艰巨，后来不了了之。

sentences.english: This is perhaps the biggest part of the migration.
sentences.chinese: 这可能是迁移时要做的最大工作量。

definition: to work/(of a machine) to operate/job/work/task/CL:個|个[ge4],份[fen4],項|项[xiang4]
lit. to continuously revolve/to work non-stop/to work around the clock (idiom)
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
